div.div: “Everyone I know who has a kid under 10 has a tablet in the house. And that tablet is the babysitter."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VXWbG9&via=Digg&text=Did Apple Kill The Toy?

div.div: BEST USE OF A BUNK BED EVER

div.a: Redditor Builds Spaceship For Son From Scrap Broadcast Equipment

div.div: Redditor (and father of the year) JeremiahGorman posted these photos of a simulated spaceship he built for his son Finn’s fifth birthday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ti8pv8&via=Digg&text=Redditor Builds Spaceship For Son From Scrap Broadcast Equipment

div.a: The Onion Nailed The NRA's Sandy Hook Statement Way Back In May

div.div: Anyone who expected “meaningful contributions” to the gun debate from the National Rifle Association following the Sandy Hook shootings that robbed us of 20 children and six brave adults probably doesn’t read The Onion.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UkbQ6l&via=Digg&text=The Onion Nailed The NRA's Sandy Hook Statement Way Back In May

div.div: WE'RE NUMBER ONE! WE'RE NUMBER ONE!

div.a: Why Do Americans Have Less Vacation Time Than Anyone Else?

div.div: Here's how the United States stacks up against the rest of the developed world in number of mandatory days off each year.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RN00mc&via=Digg&text=Why Do Americans Have Less Vacation Time Than Anyone Else?

div.div: This is version 2 of an attempt to create the most useless machine.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TdtzOo&via=Digg&text=The Most Useless Machine

div.div: Each year, Craigslist users across the country flag their favorite classified ads for inclusion in the "best of" category. The bar to inclusion is high, but somehow each year America comes through with memorable postings that remind us just why we went ahead with this whole Web 2.0 thing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3W6m1&via=Digg&text=The Craziest Craigslist Posts Of 2012

div.a: How A Pro Wrestler Became Santa Claus

div.div: The fake beard made me look scary. Once upon a time in my early WWE days, I would have taken a child crying at the sight of me as a tremendous compliment. But as Santa, I wanted to cause cheer, not fear, and as little bawling as possible.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZYNWR6&via=Digg&text=How A Pro Wrestler Became Santa Claus

div.a: Verizon Reveals Customer Data Was Leaked By Marketing Firm

div.div: Verizon is sharing more details about the alleged leak of customer data that occurred over the weekend. The company still insists there was no breach, but the carrier has now revealed to TNW that an unnamed third-party marketing firm is to blame.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VXW2T9&via=Digg&text=Verizon Reveals Customer Data Was Leaked By Marketing Firm

div.a: Turkish Professor Wants Santa's Bones Back

div.div: With an address at the North Pole, every child knows where Santa Claus lives. But the ancient remains of the person on whom the mythical figure of Father Christmas is based are at the centre of a tug-of-war.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WIaWDf&via=Digg&text=Turkish Professor Wants Santa's Bones Back

div.div: FAKE DIPLOMAS, CARS, A STUFFED JAGUAR
Here are some pictures of what the palace of Tunisia's former dictator looked like from the inside.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vn1hLw&via=Digg&text=Inside A Dictator's Palace

div.a: 9 Disturbing Christmas Ads You Won't Believe Are Real

div.div: Here are more old-school holiday ads that make us wonder what the hell the past was thinking.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WI4cp5&via=Digg&text=9 Disturbing Christmas Ads You Won't Believe Are Real

div.a: Meet The World's Newest Billionaire, A 36-Year-Old 'Surfer Dude'

div.div: Nick Woodman is the 36-year-old founder and CEO of GoPro, a wearable camera produced by Woodman Labs that can capture footage for athletes as they whiz down a mountain or surf 6-foot waves.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VdXioL&via=Digg&text=Meet The World's Newest Billionaire, A 36-Year-Old 'Surfer Dude'

div.a: 'He Wanted To Be President Less Than Anyone I've Met In My Life'

div.div: Mitt Romney's son gave some explanations for why his dad lost the 2012 election.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VZl9VZ&via=Digg&text='He Wanted To Be President Less Than Anyone I've Met In My Life'

div.div: To understand a murder-suicide, one has to start with the suicide, because that is the engine of such acts. Adam Lanza committed an act of hatred, but it seems that the person he hated the most was himself.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RcOu23&via=Digg&text=Anatomy Of A Murder-Suicide

div.a: Newsweek Wastes Its Final Cover With A Hashtag

div.div: On December 31st, Newsweek magazine will end its print run, shifting its content to an online-only format called Newsweek Global.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UUcHb8&via=Digg&text=Newsweek Wastes Its Final Cover With A Hashtag

div.a: The Secret Algorithm One VC Firm Uses To Pick Entrepreneurs

div.div: Every VC firm has its own way of evaluating potential investments. Remmy Oxley, an anonymous VC, says that Moneyball-style methods are the next step, and reveals his firm’s algorithm for screening candidates.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TOxWvR&via=Digg&text=The Secret Algorithm One VC Firm Uses To Pick Entrepreneurs

div.div: SURPRISING HOW MUCH FREE TV IS PIRATED

div.a: What Were The Most Pirated TV-Shows Of 2012?

div.div: Here are the top ten most pirated TV-shows of 2012.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VmZ1Uk&via=Digg&text=What Were The Most Pirated TV-Shows Of 2012?

div.a: Hacker Scouts Are The New Boy Scouts

div.div: In recent months, Scoutlike groups that concentrate on technology and do-it-yourself projects have been sprouting up around the country. They're coed and, like traditional Scouting organizations, award patches to kids who master skills.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TNF7nR&via=Digg&text=Hacker Scouts Are The New Boy Scouts

div.div: Apple Maps stands at the end of a long line of cartographic catastrophes. Say goodbye to the Mountains of Kong and New South Greenland—the enchanting era of geographic gaffes is coming to a close.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UZtUzo&via=Digg&text=The End Of The Map

div.a: Neil deGrasse Tyson Dancing To Michael Jackson

div.div: In which Neil deGrasse Tyson continues to get more awesome.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UlbNHC&via=Digg&text=Neil deGrasse Tyson Dancing To Michael Jackson

div.div: AN iPHONE BY ANY OTHER NAME

div.a: The Brazilian iPhone Is Actually An Android Device

div.div: The "iPhone" that came out in Brazil this week rocks Android 2.3 and the company behind it has no plans to change their ways.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vcy6it&via=Digg&text=The Brazilian iPhone Is Actually An Android Device
